forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 59 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind 7 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco today, the sky hangs heavy with clouds, the air dense with a hint of impending rain. As the day unfolds, temperatures will hover around the comfortable low sixties before dipping slightly in the afternoon. The gentle but persistent breeze from the south-southwest carries with it whispers of moisture and occasional gusts, sending a shiver of coolness that lingers as a reminder of the marine layer’s presence. Fog swathes the edges of the city, lending a mystical allure to the Golden Gate Bridge as it silently breaks through the shroud—a ghostly silhouette against the backdrop of gray.

With the forecast indicating a continuation of this cloud-laden sky into the evening, one might find solace in a cozy café, savoring the warmth of a freshly brewed coffee while watching droplets trace the windows. An umbrella could serve as a reliable companion for those venturing out, though the rain may only offer a light kiss rather than a torrential downpour. Consider wearing layers—a soft sweater beneath a light jacket that can shield against the chill without feeling cumbersome. As the sun begins to slip away, opt for activities that embrace this intimate weather: a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero, the rhythmic sound of the waves against the pier blending with the distant hum of city life, could prove to be a poetic choice amidst the moody ambiance that envelops our beloved city.
